intro: Andersoniodoxa, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plants are evergreen shrubs characterized by their dense, leathery foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. They typically grow in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Andersoniodoxa species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in mountain ecosystems.
